channel.title: Info on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Info on PR

item.title: Swift/Objective-C Interoperability - Behind the "Configure Bridging Header" dialog
item.description: Disclaimer: Yes, I know about the typo “briding” in screenshots, but I’m lazy to redo all, so please ignore and read the article in peace :-)

item.title: RescueTime weekly summary and Google Script
item.description: I was cleaning up my mac before handing it to systems on my last job. I had a couple of days just for the Knowledge Transfer of projects and nothing else.

item.title: Raspbian + XBMC + Airplay
item.description: TL;DR: Yes, you can. If you are only interested in the steps skip to the relevant section. I own a Raspberry Pi for closer to a year now.

item.title: Grep - Swiss army knife
item.description: I have used this command sparingly in the past and I recently learnt more options by solving couple of my problems.

item.title: Request To Webdevs: Include IP/User-Agent Info In Forgot Password Email
item.description: The Forgot password email template has been the same for more than a decade. It is time to include more information in the email.

item.title: Book Recommendation: Testing with coffeescript by Jack Franklin [Free ebook]
item.description: TDD (Test Driven Development) was introduced to me around 2006 with PHPUnit. As a naive, I couldn’t see the benefits, eg.

item.title: Disable networking/internet from command line on a Mac
item.description: If you want to quickly disable internet/networking to test offline features. Doing it frequently with System preferences GUI is quite a slow workflow.

item.title: Laptop Cooling Pad & Sudden Motion Sensor
item.description: Finally I found a good usecase to test the Sudden Motion Sensor of my macbook pro. I was curious to know whether there is an impact of cooling pad’s fan.

item.title: Project Plan and Gantter.com
item.description: Project planning is always a difficult task for me. I could do anything to skip the project planning because for following reasons:

item.title: Expired distribution provisioning and Yak shaving
item.description: Last Thursday one of my iPad app’s provisioning file has expired. Client brought it to us at the very late moment, the iPad app was distributed internally as an enterprise app.

item.title: Idea Vault: Tree view
item.description: A Bookmarklet or a Browser extension to select the root element of a DOM (UL/OL) to view the Inverted tree structure of its child nodes.

item.title: Project Dumps
item.description: Wish you all a very happy new year! It is 2013, another chance for us/me to start a new beginning. I believed in Mayan so much, I never had a plan post 20th Dec 2012 :)

item.title: iForce - Sublime text plugin for salesforce development.
item.description: I wrote a small plugin for sublime text to develop salesforce. I’m glad to share one of my idea to project execution.

item.title: Failed to get brightness for displayID
item.description: If you are experiencing frequent disk I/O and your console is full of 25/08/12 4:30:19.506 PM ALSPlugin 235.55[62]: Failed to get brightness for displayID 0x042731c0

item.title: How to install Grease monkey scripts on Google Chrome 21
item.description: Chrome updated its policy to not to install extensions and scripts outside of Google webstore by default. (Gatekeeper, everyone wants to be the police)

item.title: Developing iOS application for salesforce [How to]
item.description: Here are the collection of snippets to do CRUD operation with ZKSforce (Force.com toolkit for iOS). Remember this is a SOAP based API, there is a new alternative library available from salesforce called MobileSDK for iOS.

item.title: BTServer CPU Usage
item.description: I recently uninstalled all previous versions of xcode (I had all xcode from ios 3.2.x) to install 4.2 on my MBP.

item.title: RIL2Insta - Import Read it Later links to Instapaper
item.description: One of my long time wish to write a Chrome extension completed last week. It all started when my answer was down-voted at apple.

item.title: Distribute your iPhone/iPad adhoc builds Over The Air using Dropbox
item.description: Update: I recently found this site called diawi.com which allows you to distribute the app similar to file-sharing sites, drag and drop ipa file and share the link to the testers.

item.title: Shell script to generate images for testing
item.description: Recently I was in need of generating sample images for no. of products in my db. I really hate to create a copy of image for each products in my db.

item.title: How to view (Windows) line ending characters on Mac OSX
item.description: Notepad++ on windows has this beautiful option “View all characters” to display all invisbile characters such as line endings. Programming editors on mac like Textwrangler and Textmate has an option to Show Invisibles but failed to display the character block for Carriage Return as Notepad used to.

item.title: Recommended Git workflow
item.description: I recently started using Git as my revision control tool. Impressed by the use of branching and merging, I create and merge a lot of branches.

item.title: Desktop Notification with Html5
item.description: I’ve recently stumbled upon studio.html5rocks.com and found the cool trick to display desktop notifications like Gmail. I thought it is cool, thinking of including it in any of my app I plan to do.

item.title: Play Angrybirds on web (Chrome)
item.description: HD for good configuration computers | SD for little out of date computers For those who wants to see all levels without completing a level or struck in a level, here is the hack, copy the following code, paste it on url textbox and hit enter.

item.title: Enter into / Exit from Recovery mode for iPhone
item.description: Yes, every post you come across suggest the same thing, hold your power button and home button for X seconds. Though it is true, unfortunately I had a couple of situations my iphone doesn’t respond to the key combinations.

item.title: Capture screenshot of the app with iPad simulator
item.description: Until recently I was not aware of the shortcut Ctrl + Cmd + C It captures the complete content of the iPad simulator to the clipboard, You can save it to a file by File -> New from Clipboard with preview.

item.title: We are the Champions
item.description: After all the hiccups over years, we were able to witness the ultimate glory of bring back the cup to India after 28 years.

item.title: Advanced iPhone Development - iTunesU
item.description: Recent search on iTunes listed the Madison Area Technical College classes on iPhone development by Dr. Brad Larson Session on OpenGL ES 2.

item.title: Idea Vault: Tile this!
item.description: Update: Check the extension and more information @ Idea to action: Tile this I was recently hunting images for a sample design.

item.title: Import Delicious bookmarks to Evernote including tags
item.description: It is unfortunate to know that Yahoo is going to shutdown/transfer the awesome Delicious bookmarking service. Evernote does not support direct import of bookmarks from delicious as it does with Google notebook.

item.title: Idea Vault: When is that?
item.description: I guess like me there will be many people often confuse appointments/client calls due to timezone differences. I am not talking about people who send/receive schedules from Outlook (or similar apps).

item.title: My new photo (screenshot sharing) blog
item.description: A colleague told me that I should be a QA Engineer in a random conversation few months ago. Though I did not consider it but he stands by it even now.

item.title: Mac App Store - Source
item.description: You get the idea? You are not looking for the UI code are you? Saurik will be doing the UI for us ;)

item.title: GotoMeeting Video recording (G2M3 codec for Mac)
item.description: If you use GotoMeeting to record video of the shared screen, make sure that you DO NOT use G2M3 codec. It does a great job in compressing the size of the video but it is not compatible with OSX or any OS other than Windows.

item.title: Apple Sep 1, 2010 Event under 3 min
item.description: Youtube link Content requires Javascript to be enabled. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-24euRgImPg p.noscript{ background-color: #fefea0; border-left: 4px solid #fea0a0; padding: 0 0.

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part II
item.description: iTunes 10 Another iTunes upgrade, I don’t want to see another 100Mb iTunes upgrade till next month. Many people were fighting over the icon, Guys!

item.title: Call Me A Hypocrite: My take on Apple Event Sep 1, 2010 - Part I
item.description: Only yesterday I got a chance to view the Keynote video. You can also download the video from iTunes for Free.

item.title: Snow Leopard (Retail) on Lenovo 3000 N100
item.description: Disclaimer: There is no alternative to real Mac, if you like Mac go and buy it. If buying a real Mac is too much, you can at least buy a license for Mac OS X Snow Leopard which costs $29 only.

item.title: Angry Birds – I give up
item.description: Angry Birds is one great app in Apple App Store that worth every penny (Full version is only $0.99)

item.title: Random Notes: LAMP/Web development |Tools & Best practices
item.description: I was planning to write a post similar to this for very long time. My intension is to help beginners to know the jargons and best practices.

item.title: WWDC 2010 - iPhone 4
item.description: iPad didn’t replace common tasks. Steve was referring his notepad on stage:). Old habits die hard. Steve can still memorize 24 countries and repeat them in the same order.

item.title: Download Apple WWDC Keynote videos
item.description: I was always disappointed with Apple Keynote pages. It allows you to stream and watch the videos with QuickTime which is not great for streaming and videos are not HTML5 yet.

item.title: iPad - My Experience
item.description: Warning: My observations are biased as I’m not an Apple Fanboy, at least right now (was one in the past, I both respect and hate Apple & Microsoft)

item.title: Solving Read-Only Notes.app issue
item.description: Notes.app of miPhone was not allowing me to save any new notes. This was after restoring the manual backup of notes.

item.title: Hackintosh Guide: Snow Leopard 10.6.1-10.6.2 Intel AMD made by Hazard
item.description: Last Saturday I was successful in installing Snow Leopard on Sony Vaio with Core i3 Processor. I have tried many distro’s in past 2 years and I can tell you it is not easy to install on any given PC.

item.title: PeerGuardian and history.db
item.description: PeerGuardian is a great tool to maintain your privacy. But you should be aware of a fact that it uses a sqlite db to maintain the history called history.

item.title: WinDirStat | My Software Toolbox
item.description: No matter how large your hard drive is, the data will grow to fill the disk! Recently I was running out of space on both of my internal 120Gig and external 320Gig HDD.

item.title: Obj-C | For beginners
item.description: A quick obj-c cheat-sheet for the beginners. Scribd link This is taken from RWTH-iPhone Application Programming. You can also download complete videos from iTunesU.

item.title: Batch renaming of files (Mac OSX / *nix)
item.description: How to batch/bulk rename files with automatic sequence number? Try the following shell script from your terminal (OSX/*nix) Create a new directory

item.title: [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile '579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB' can't be found
item.description: Check dependencies Code Sign error: Provisioning profile [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile ‘579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB’ can’t be found Anyone who is relatively new to iPhone development could easily identify this issue is related to the invalid provisioning profile.

item.title: Why AppStore submission process sucks!
item.description: They only check the binary to see if they use any private API nothing other than that. Sometimes they reject the app and give you a reason that it doesn’t fit with their HIG standards.

item.title: iPhone – Accessibility
item.description:
What if iPhone provides an accessibility option for users with bigger finger?
I found that pinch to zoom and screenshot capturing can be considered as good photo cropping tool.

item.title: Objective-C Crash Course for Web Developers
item.description: Please find the below presentation which explains obj-c for web developers (js/php). This is taken from SXSW’10. I’m also searching for the video will share if I come across any.

item.title: Nobody is using NOSCRIPT tag?
item.description: It seems nobody is using NOSCRIPT tag. I never used in my application as well. But it is surprising that even Google itself ignoring the NOSCRIPT.

item.title: How to Register iTunes Account for Free (In Any Country Without A Credit Card)
item.description: Follow the steps below: Launch iTunes Log out of your account (if any) Scroll down the iTunes page and hit the flag on the right Select your country of interest Try to buy a random free app (Note: You will see payment option None only when you register after/while downloading a free app) iTunes will ask you for your credentials, hit open a new account Accept the terms Enter a valid email, pick a password and so on.

item.title: IPL 3 on YouTube
item.description: If you have Airtel broadband + unlimited bandwidth then you are lucky to enjoy IPL without commercials. YouTube IPL channel can be viewed with 2Mbps speed without any extra cost.

item.title: Hello world!
item.description: Everyone starts with a “Hello world” so do I. No idea on what I’m going to write; will I ever write something useful.
